abstract: Smooth-Stone, a semiconductor start-up, has pulled in $48 million from an international group of investors in a bid to disrupt one of Intel’s most lucrative franchises: server chips.
snippet: Smooth-Stone, a semiconductor start-up, has pulled in $48 million from an international group of investors in a bid to disrupt one of Intel’s most lucrative franchises: server chips.
lead_paragraph: A group of investors, including companies from the United States, Europe and the United Arab Emirates, has formed in a bid to disrupt one of Intel’s most lucrative franchises, The New York Times’s Ashlee Vance reported Monday.

headline.main: A Chip Start-Up Aims to Slay Intel
